intro: Memecylon calderense, commonly known as the Caldeira memecylon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in humid, lowland forests and is often found in secondary vegetation. Memecylon calderense plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
